objectStorage

Methods for interacting with the Object Storage endpoints
https://www.vultr.com/api/#objectstorage

Methods

create(parameters)

Create an object storage subscription.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#objectstorage_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
OBJSTORECLUSTERID number Cluster to use for object storage.
label string <optional>
 Text label that will be associated with the subscription.
Source:
  • object-storage.js, line 38

delete(parameters)

Destroy an object storage subscription. All objects will be permanently deleted. There is no going back from this call.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#objectstorage_destroy
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier for this subscription.
Source:
  • object-storage.js, line 64

list(parameters)

List all object storage subscriptions on the current account. This includes both pending and active subscriptions.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#objectstorage__list
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
include_s3 string <optional>
 'yes' 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', include S3 keys with each subscription entry.
SUBID number <optional>
 Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
label string <optional>
 A text label string. Only subscription objects with this text label will be returned.
Source:
  • object-storage.js, line 7

listCluster()

Clusters may be removed over time. The "deploy" field can be used to determine whether or not new deployments are allowed in the cluster.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#objectstorage_list_cluster
Source:
  • object-storage.js, line 111

Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier for this subscription.
s3_access_key string Access key from keypair to be regenerated.
